[![Artwork from "Hello, Quarto" keynote by Julia Lowndes and Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel, presented at RStudio Conference 2022. Illustrated by Allison Horst.](images/quarto2.png){width="2788"}](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p7Hxu4coDl8)

## Why Quarto?

::: incremental
-   Multilingual and independent of computational systems
-   Shared expression for core features
-   Enable “single-source publishing” — create Word, PDFs, HTML, etc. from one source
-   Reproducibility — document your process and make it easy to reproduce and replicate your work
:::

## Setting up Quarto

::: incremental
1.  Install [R](https://cloud.r-project.org/) and [RStudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)
2.  Install the latest version of [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)
3.  Install the `rmarkdown` package
4.  Install TinyTeX in RStudio and the `tinytex` package in R
5.  Create an account in [Quarto Pub](https://quartopub.com/)
:::
